subject: Mental Health
title: Mourning and Bereavement
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mourning and Bereavement usable.

hook.text: Grief is what you feel inside. Mourning is how you express it. Both are necessary.

buildup.text: Bereavement is the state of having lost someone; mourning is the outward expression of grief.

discovery.text: Cultures that have strong mourning rituals tend to have better grief outcomes.

twist.text: Modern society has shortened mourning â€” most jobs offer only 3 days of bereavement leave.

climax.text: Without space to mourn, grief goes underground and manifests as anxiety or physical illness.

punchline.text: A society that won't let you mourn won't let you heal.

quiz.question: What is the difference between grief and mourning?
options: Grief is internal feeling; mourning is outward expression
